info.description: This is a basic API for GovStack's Consent Management Building Block. It reflects the basic requirements of the Consent Management BB specification, which is versioned .
info.title: Consent Management BB API

tags.name: org
tags.description: Secured operations available to organization API integration

tags.name: dataconsumer
tags.description: Secured operations for data consumers and applications to verify consent

tags.name: auditor
tags.description: Operations for external auditing systems to query detailed data from the system and subscribe to notifications.

tags.name: notification
tags.description: Subscribe/unsubscribe notifications for data processors, consumers and frontend systems for individuals.

tags.name: callback
tags.description: Callback API for other Building Blocks, especially relevant for asynchronous processes.

get.summary: Returns a list of readable Policy objects
get.description: LIST - Fetches list of readable Policy objects

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response requested by client

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response requested by client

200.description: A list of Policy objects readable for the current session's credentials.

post.summary: CREATE - Creates a new Policy object and returns the new object and a PolicyRevision
post.description: CREATE - Creates a new Policy object and returns the new object and a PolicyRevision

200.description: A set consisting of the new Policy object created, together with the initial Revision object.

get.summary: READ - get a Policy object + latest Revision. If a PolicyFilter is supplied and contains a revision_id, then this specific revision is returned.
get.description: READ - get a Policy object + latest Revision. If a PolicyFilter is supplied and contains a revision_id, then this specific revision is returned.

put.summary: UPDATE - Updates an existing Policy object, returning the updated version and a new revision. Updating a Policy does not affect existing references in Agreement, the new revision should be specified for Agreement.
put.description: UPDATE - Updates an existing Policy object, returning the updated version and a new revision. Updating a Policy does not affect existing references in Agreement, the new revision should be specified for Agreement.

delete.summary: DELETE - Deletes an existing Policy object, returning the updated version and a new revision. Deleting a Policy is not possible if it's associated with active Agreement.
delete.description: DELETE - Deletes an existing Policy object, returning the updated version and a new revision. Deleting a Policy is not possible if it's associated with active Agreement.

get.summary: LIST - returns a Policy object with a list of all Revisions
get.description: LIST - returns a Policy object with a list of all Revisions

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response requested by client

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response requested by client

put.description: UPDATE - An existing Agreement object is created and returned together with AgreementRevision

put.summary: UPDATE - invalidates/withdraws a ConsentRecord, for usage in unconventional withdrawal of consent, for instance if withdrawal happens through an email or phone call.
put.description: UPDATE - invalidates/withdraws a ConsentRecord, for usage in unconventional withdrawal of consent, for instance if withdrawal happens through an email or phone call.

post.description: CREATE - Creates an Individual in the Consent system

get.description: READ - Fetch an Individual in the Consent system

put.summary: UPDATE - Updates an Individual in the Consent system
put.description: UPDATE - Updates an Individual in the Consent system

delete.summary: DELETE - entirely removes an individual from the system and cascades necessary actions to related ConsentRecord objects
delete.description: DELETE - entirely removes an individual from the system and cascades necessary actions to related ConsentRecord objects

get.summary: LIST - Fetch consent records. For a given Agreement and Individual, query if consent exists
get.description: LIST - Fetch consent records. For a given Agreement and Individual, query if consent exists

post.summary: CREATE - For a particular Individual and a particular Agreement, create a new Consent Record pointing to the current Revision of a given Agreement
post.description: CREATE - For a particular Individual and a particular Agreement, create a new Consent Record pointing to the current Revision of a given Agreement

delete.summary: DELETE - Cascading delete operation for Right To Be Forgotten, deletes all Consent Records that shall not be retained and have a "forgettable" Agreement.
delete.description: DELETE - Cascading delete operation for Right To Be Forgotten, deletes all Consent Records that shall not be retained and have a "forgettable" Agreement.

post.description: CREATE - A new AuditTracker is set up

get.summary: READ - get the details of an AuditTracker
get.description: READ - get the details of an AuditTracker

put.summary: UPDATE - get the details of an AuditTracker
put.description: UPDATE - get the details of an AuditTracker

Individual.description: Models an individual, with details referenced from an external system (registration system, functional ID, foundational ID etc). A unique entry in this model is not to be mistaken with a unique natural individual. It is up to the system owner to decide if this record permits mapping to a natural individual and/or if a single Individual row can map to several consent agreements.

id.description: The unique ID of a Individual row.

functional_id.description: Non-mandatory reference to a functional ID, which is likely PII

session_id.description: An "individual" may simply be mapped to a temporary session?

Agreement.description: An agreement contains the specification of a single purpose that can be consented to. An Agreement is universal and can be consented to by *many* individuals through a ConsentRecord

version.description: The version of this specification to which a receipt conforms

lawful_basis.description: Lawful basis of the agreement - consent / legal_obligation / contract / vital_interest / public_task / legitimate_interest

active.description: Agreement is active and new ConsentRecords can be created.

forgettable.description: Agreement may be deleted when consent is withdrawn, as its existence is not necessary for auditability.

AgreementData.description: Agreement data contains specifications of exactly what is collected.

name.description: Name of the attribute, for instance "name" or "age"

sensitivity.description: TBD: categories of sensitivity from som ISO

hash.description: In order to sign an Agreement, this relation needs to have a cryptopgraphic hash to be included in the Signature of the Agreement.

Policy.description: A policy governs the processing and use of data in the organization that is "data controller" and owner of Agreement.

url.description: Permanent URL at which this very version of the Policy can be read, should not be allowed to change over time.

ConsentRecord.description: A consent record expresses consent (as defined in this building block's specification) to a single Agreement.

opt_in.description: True: The individual has positively opted in. False: The individual has explicitly said no (or withdrawn a previous consent).

Revision.description:
A *generic* revision model captures the serialized contents of any shema's single row. This is then subject to 1) cryptographic signature and 2) auditing.

Aside from "successor" column, a revision should be considered locked.

authorized_by_other.description: Reference to an admin user that has created this revision

predecessor_signature.description: Tamper-resistent artifact from previous record (we don't know if the previous record was signed or not)

AgreementFilter.description: Query filter for API endpoint listing Agreement objects

ConsentRecordFilter.description: Query filter for API endpoint listing ConsentRecord objects

PolicyFilter.description: Query filter for API endpoint listing Policy objects

name.description: Name of data controller (may be omitted if no data involved)

url.description: URL of data controller (may be omitted if no data involved)

Signature.description: A generic signature contains a cryptographic hash of some value, together with a signature created by some private key in another system. Required signing methods: Revision object or another Signature object.

verification_hash.description: Internally generated cryptographic hash of the value to be signed.

jws_header.description: Alternative to the verification_method, verification_hash and verification_signature, give a JWS serialized object (RFC7515)

signed_by.description: Identifier information may change over time. This field could contain a natural individual's names, personal number, email addresses - store a snapshot that binds to the signature at the time of signing.

object_reference.description: A symmetric relation / back reference to the object_type that was signed. We are currently just modelling signing another signature (a chain) or signing a Revision (which can be a revision of an agreement, policy etc)

AgreementPurpose.description: TBD: Models the purpose of an agreement

AgreementLifecycle.description: TBD: Models the valid lifecycle states of an Agreement

RegistryReference.description: TBD: When creating an Invidiual, we need some input that refers to a functional or foundational ID in an external system

AuditTracker.description: TBD: An external tracker receiving information from the system that can be subject to external auditing and verification of correct behavior

public_key.description: The auditing system's public key for encrypting data sent to callback functions

callback_agreement.description: A URL receiving a callback with the Agreement object + Revision + AuditEventType

callback_consent_record.description: A URL receiving a callback with the ConsentRecord object + Revision + AuditEventType

callback_policy.description: A URL receiving a callback with the Policy object + Revision + AuditEventType

callback_revision_table_hash.description: A URL receiving a callback with <string> + AuditEventType. Periodically, the system can publish the hash of the revision table.

callback_signature_table_hash.description: A URL receiving a callback with <string> + AuditEventType. Periodically, the system can publish the hash of the signature table.

AuditEventType.description: TBD: Model for the possible events pertaining a change to an object subject to auditing.

scopes.consumer: Grants access to data consumer operations
scopes.individual: Grants access to specific individual read/write operations
scopes.auditor: Grants access to specific auditor read operations
